name: tariff
description: Get information about a tariff by the tariff ID

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that owns this tariff

fields.name: party_id
fields.description: CPO ID of the CPO that owns this tariff (following the ISO-15118 standard)

fields.name: id
fields.description: Uniquely identifies the tariff within the CPO’s platform (and suboperator platforms)

fields.name: currency
fields.description: ISO-4217 code of the currency of this tariff.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Defines the type of the tariff. This allows for distinction in case of given charging preferences. When omitted, this tariff is valid for all sessions

children.name: AD_HOC_PAYMENT
children.description: Used to describe that a tariff is valid when ad-hoc payment is used at the charge point (for example: Debit or Credit card payment terminal)

children.name: PROFILE_CHEAP
children.description: Used to describe that a tariff is valid when charging preference: CHEAP is set for the session

children.name: PROFILE_FAST
children.description: Used to describe that a tariff is valid when charging preference: FAST is set for the session

children.name: PROFILE_GREEN
children.description: Used to describe that a tariff is valid when charging preference: GREEN is set for the session

children.name: REGULAR
children.description: Used to describe that a tariff is valid when using an RFID, without any charging preference, or when charging preference: REGULAR is set for the session

fields.name: tariff_alt_text
fields.description: List of alternative tariff information texts, in multiple languages

children.name: language
children.description: Language Code ISO 639-1

children.name: text
children.description: Text to be displayed to an end user. No markup, html etc. allowed.

fields.name: tariff_alt_url
fields.description: URL to a web page that contains an explanation of the tariff information in human readable form

fields.name: min_price
fields.description: When this field is set, a charging session with this tariff will cost at least the amount shown. This is different from a FLAT fee (start tariff, transaction fee), as a FLAT fee is a fixed amount that must be paid for any charging session. A minimum price indicates that when the cost of a charging session is lower than this amount, the cost of the session will be equal to this amount

children.name: excl_vat
children.description: Price/Cost excluding VAT.

children.name: incl_vat
children.description: Price/Cost including VAT.

fields.name: max_price
fields.description: When this field is set, a charging session with this tariff will NOT cost more than this amount

children.name: excl_vat
children.description: Price/Cost excluding VAT.

children.name: incl_vat
children.description: Price/Cost including VAT.

children.name: price_components
children.description: List of price components that describe the pricing of a tariff.

children.name: type
children.description: Type of tariff dimension.

children.name: ENERGY
children.description: Defined in kWh, step_size multiplier: 1 Wh

children.name: FLAT
children.description: Flat fee without unit for step_size

children.name: PARKING_TIME
children.description: Time not charging: defined in hours, step_size multiplier: 1 second

children.name: TIME
children.description: Time charging: defined in hours, step_size multiplier: 1 second Can also be used in combination with a RESERVATION restriction to describe the price of the reservation time.

children.name: price
children.description: Price per unit (excl. VAT) for this tariff dimension.

children.name: vat
children.description: Applicable VAT percentage for this tariff dimension. If omitted, no VAT is applicable. Not providing a VAT is different from 0% VAT, which would be a value of 0.0 here.

children.name: step_size
children.description: Minimum amount to be billed. This unit will be billed in this step_size blocks. For example: if type is TIME and step_size has a value of 300, then time will be billed in blocks of 5 minutes. If 6 minutes were used, 10 minutes (2 blocks of step_size) will be billed.

children.name: restrictions
children.description: Restrictions that describe the applicability of a tariff.

children.name: start_time
children.description: Start time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 13:30, valid from this time of the day. Must be in 24h format with leading zeros. Hour/Minute separator: ":" Regex: ([0-1][0-9]|2[1-3]):[0-5][0-9]

children.name: end_time
children.description: End time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 19:45, valid until this time of the day. Same syntax as start_time.

children.name: start_date
children.description: Start date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-24, valid from this day. Regex: ([12][0-9]{3})-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])

children.name: end_date
children.description: End date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-27, valid until this day (exclusive). Same syntax as start_date

children.name: min_kwh
children.description: Minimum consumed energy in kWh, for example 20, valid from this amount of energy being used

children.name: max_kwh
children.description: Maximum consumed energy in kWh, for example 50, valid until this amount of energy being used

children.name: min_current
children.description: Sum of the minimum current in over all phases, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than the defined amount of current, this tariff element is/becomes active. If the charging current is or becomes lower, this tariff element is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This does not describe the minimum current over the entire charging session. This restriction can make a tariff element become active when the charging current is above the defined value, but the tariff element MUST no longer be active when the charging current drops below the defined value

children.name: max_current
children.description: Sum of the maximum current in over all phases, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of current, this tariff element becomes/is active. If the charging current is or becomes higher, this tariff element is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a tariff element become active when the charging current is below this value, but the tariff element MUST  no longer be active when the charging current raises above the defined value

children.name: min_power
children.description: Minimum power in kW, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than the defined amount of power, this tariff element is/becomes active. If the charging power is or becomes lower, this tariff element is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This does not describe the minimum power over the entire charging session. This restriction can make a tariff element become active when the charging power is above this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power drops below the defined value

children.name: max_power
children.description: Maximum power in kW, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of power, this tariff element becomes/is active. If the charging power is or becomes higher, this tariff element is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This does not describe the maximum power over the entire charging session. This restriction can make a tariff element become active when the charging power is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power raises above the defined value

children.name: min_duration
children.description: Minimum duration in seconds the charging session MUST last (inclusive). When the duration of a charging session is longer than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. Before that moment, this tariff element is not yet active

children.name: max_duration
children.description: Maximum duration in seconds the charging session MUST last (exclusive). When the duration of a charging session is shorter than the defined value, this tariff element is or becomes active. After that moment, this tariff element is no longer active

children.name: day_of_week
children.description: Which day(s) of the week this tariff element is active.

children.name: reservation
children.description: When this field is present, the tariff element describes reservation costs. A reservation starts when the reservation is made, and ends when the drivers starts charging on the reserved EVSE/Location, or when the reservation expires. A reservation can only have: FLAT and TIME TariffDimensions, where TIME is for the duration of the reservation

children.name: RESERVATION
children.description: Used in TariffElements to describe costs for a reservation.

children.name: RESERVATION_EXPIRES
children.description: Used in TariffElements to describe costs for a reservation that expires (i.e. driver does not start a charging session before expiry_date of the reservation).

fields.name: start_date_time
fields.description: Time when this tariff becomes active, in UTC, time_zone field of the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used for a new tariff that is already given with the location, before it becomes active

fields.name: end_date_time
fields.description: Time after which this tariff is no longer valid, in UTC, time_zone field if the location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used when this tariff is going to be replaced with a different tariff in the near future

fields.name: energy_mix
fields.description: Details about the energy supplied with this tariff

children.name: is_green_energy
children.description: True if the power is 100% from regenerative sources

children.name: energy_sources
children.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of energy sources of this location’s tariff.

children.name: source
children.description: The type of energy source.

children.name: NUCLEAR
children.description: Nuclear power sources.

children.name: GENERAL_FOSSIL
children.description: All kinds of fossil power sources.

children.name: COAL
children.description: Fossil power from coal.

children.name: GAS
children.description: Fossil power from gas.

children.name: GENERAL_GREEN
children.description: All kinds of regenerative power sources.

children.name: SOLAR
children.description: Regenerative power from PV.

children.name: WIND
children.description: Regenerative power from wind turbines.

children.name: WATER
children.description: Regenerative power from water turbines.

children.name: percentage
children.description: Percentage of this source (0-100) in the mix.

children.name: environ_impact
children.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of nuclear waste and CO2 exhaust of this location’s tariff.

children.name: category
children.description: The environmental impact category of this value.

children.name: NUCLEAR_WASTE
children.description: Produced nuclear waste in grams per kilowatthour.

children.name: CARBON_DIOXIDE
children.description: Exhausted carbon dioxide in grams per kilowatthour.

children.name: amount
children.description: Amount of this portion in g/kWh.

children.name: supplier_name
children.description: Name of the energy supplier, delivering the energy for this location or tariff.*

children.name: energy_product_name
children.description: Name of the energy suppliers product/tariff plan used at this location.*

fields.name: last_updated
fields.description: Timestamp when this tariff was last updated (or created)
